table.summary: Table containing one link on each row

td.a: NJ Public Schools Continue Remote Learning Until May 15th
td.br: This week, Governor Murphy declared that all New Jersey Schools will remain on remote learning until May 15. We are confident that our preparedness plan implemented on March 17 will continue to provide the highest quality education possible for our Rancocas Valley students. We continually seek to improve this plan through the lens of flexibility and equity for all. Please click on the COVID-19 link on the left-side of the front page of the website for all communications including lists of canceled events and field trips.

If your income has changed due to COVID-19 and you believe you may qualify for Free or Reduced lunch, you may apply two ways: (1) Log into your Genesis parent portal and click on the 'Forms' tab. You will find the application below the forms. If you have already submitted an application online and would like to submit a new one, please click the 'Re-Apply' button. (2) A new application can be filled out by parents that have not applied prior during this school year by going into the forms area. Please direct any questions or concerns by email to dregula@rvrhs.com

If your child is experiencing difficulties with the change in routine or is struggling to process the ramifications of what is happening globally, resources are available that may assist you by clicking the link following this news item. We also encourage you to contact your child’s guidance counselor and/or case manager for more specific support. If your child has expressed any thoughts or actions indicating that they intend to hurt themselves, you can contact Mobile Response at 1-877- 652-7624.
The date for the end of the THIRD marking period has been changed to April 21st. The first day of the FOURTH marking period will be April 22nd.
The Senior Prom will be held at a date to be determined with additional details upcoming.

img.br: AP exams will be administered from May 11–22 with makeup test dates from June 1–5. Click the link following this news item for the testing schedule. Most exams will be 45 minutes in length with 6 added minutes for uploading responses and have one or two free-response questions timed separately. Students will need to write and submit their responses within the allotted time for each question. Exams may be taken at home on any device and students will be able to type and upload their responses or write responses by hand and submit a photo via their cell phones.

td.br: To keep students safe, and in alignment with public health guidance and school closures, the College Board will not administer the SAT or SAT Subject Tests on May 2nd and June 6th. If safe from a public health standpoint, the College Board will provide weekend SAT administrations every month through the end of the calendar year beginning in August. This includes a new administration in September and the previously scheduled tests on August 29, October 3, November 7, and December 5. Students can register for these administrations starting in May. Please check the RV website as further information becomes available.
During the school closure, the district will continue to meet the needs of special education students. Please read the attached letter for further details.

img.br: Attention Juniors: If you are interested in attending the Senior Class Trip to Walt Disney World next year, you must submit a deposit of $500 by Monday, June 8th. Please download the attached letter for more information. Questions about the trip should be directed to Mrs. Rosenthal (jrosenthal@rvrhs.com).

td.a: 2015 RV Alum Shaun Bradley Eyed by Giants for NFL Draft

img.br: The Giants have shown interest in Temple linebacker and 2015 RV alum, Shaun Bradley, who has the potential of beings selected between the fourth and sixth rounds of the NFL draft. Shaun played running back and defensive back for coach Dan Haussman earning first team all-county as an RV senior after rushing for 1,467 yards and 22 touchdowns on 188 carries. Shaun also lettered in basketball and track earning the RV Male Athlete of the Year Award in 2014-15.

td.br: RVRHS has established a school account with Microsoft that allows students to create a free Microsoft Office 365 account. Instructions are included in the attached document. During the school closure UNTIL APRIL 10th, if an RV student has an issue with any school-related technology (problem with their school email, Google account, MacBook), he/she can email rvtechhelp@rvrhs.com or call at 609.267.0830 extension 3289 during the week from 8am to 3pm.

td.a: UPDATE: Free Internet Hotspots from Comcast
td.br: Comcast will offer Xfinity WiFi free for everyone, with hotspots available to all, including non-Xfinity subscribers. To access the service, look for the “xfinitywifi” network name in a list of hotspots. For more information, go to www.xfinity.com/wifi. Low-income families can sign up for Internet Essentials, and, as new customers, are eligible for 60 days of free service. The service, which is normally available for $9.95 to qualified low-income customers, will also see an increase in speed, which will provide faster internet access.

td.a: Do You Want a New MacBook for the 2020-2021 School Year? Do You Want WiFi Access Now?
td.br: For an RV student to gain access to the district WiFi network for 2019-2020 school year AND to receive a new MacBook for the 2020-2021 school year, you must complete our “Digital Citizenship” (DC) course and successfully pass the test.

div.p:
The Rancocas Valley Regional High School District,
a forward-thinking learning institution,
empowers every student with the knowledge and skills
to be a contributing member of the community
by providing meaningful curricular and extracurricular experiences.
